bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Core Clock

bitfields.name: AGDET_RE_EN
bitfields.description: AGDET reset must be enabled during boot (must be 00b).

bitfields.name: HEADER
bitfields.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. After this header is set, all non-zero values will take effect; leaving all settings at 0xff will cause undefined behavior. It is recommended to set all values to 0x00 before setting the CMPA header value.

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description:
Flash remap size. 
This field should be written to remap field in flash.

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion.

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command.

bitfields.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description:
Assert on ISP fall through. ROM drives the GPIO pin identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode.
[4:0] GPIO pin number
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description:
Powerdown timeout: 
Timeout value in seconds. 
When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM uses it as idle timeout value to enter power-down state to conserve power.

bitfields.name: UART_RX_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default UART RX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as UART_RX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: UART_RX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: UART_ISP_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for UART ISP mode UART_BAUD_RATE.

bitfields.name: UART_TX_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default UART TX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as UART_TX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: UART_TX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: UART_BAUD_RATE
bitfields.description: UART baud rate. Baud rate configured during UART ISP mode.

bitfields.name: I2C_SCL_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default I2C SCL ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SCL pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: I2C_SCL_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: I2C_ISP_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for I2C ISP mode.

bitfields.name: I2C_SDA_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default I2C SDA ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SDA pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: I2C_SDA_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI SCK ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: SPI_ISP_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI MOSI ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: SPI_MISO_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI MISO ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MISO pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: SPI_SSEL_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI SSEL ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SSEL pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_SSEL_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the pin mux function slot.

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_SSEL_X
bitfields.description:
SPI chip select number. 
FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects.

bitfields.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDR
bitfields.description:
I2C slave address. 
A 7-bit Address used for selecting our device on shared I2C bus system. 
By default ROM uses 0x10 as slave address.

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins.

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins.

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
registers.description:
Quick Set to Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
registers.description:
Quick Clear to Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low after reset. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot.

registers.name: ROP_STATE
registers.description:
Read Out Protection (ROP) State value. 
Device does not support secure boot, but it does support four levels of Read Out Protection, referred as ROP_STATE. 
This read out protection is a mechanism that allows user to enable different levels of protection in the system. 
ROM reads ROP_STATE from ROP_STATE and ROP_STATE_DP on IFR0, does the compare, and if it does not match, resets the device; if match then programs it to SYSCON->ROP_STATE. 
Any other value then four listed means ROP3-like behavior (debug disabled/locked, ISP disabled).

bitfields.name: ROP_STATE
bitfields.description: ROP_STATE[31:0]

values.name: ROP_LEVEL0
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xFFFF_FFFF (erased FLASH value), no ROP. Default for blank state.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL1
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xEEBA_04C3. Debug disabled and unlocked, can be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL2
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0x4939_8D8B. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL3
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xB0AB_B703. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, no debug mailbox commands available.

registers.name: ROP_STATE_DP
registers.description:
Read Out Protection (ROP) State duplicate value. 
ROM reads ROP_STATE from ROP_STATE and ROP_STATE_DP on IFR0, does the compare, and if it does not match, resets the device; if match then programs it to SYSCON->ROP_STATE. 
Any other value then four listed means ROP3-like behavior (debug disabled/locked, ISP disabled).

bitfields.name: ROP_STATE_DP
bitfields.description: ROP_STATE_DP[31:0]

values.name: ROP_LEVEL0
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xFFFF_FFFF (erased FLASH value), no ROP. Default for blank state.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL1
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xEEBA_04C3. Debug disabled and unlocked, can be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL2
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0x4939_8D8B. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, only limited debug mailbox commands available.

values.name: ROP_LEVEL3
values.description: ROP_STATE = 0xB0AB_B703. Debug disabled and locked, cannot be modified by customer, no debug mailbox commands available.
